intro: Chortolirion tenuifolium, commonly known as the slenderleaf chortolirion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
